Description: Fragment of oval handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine light brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with Helios head symbol and Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Pencil '65'. Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 181, 17. Name Xenophanes. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0188.26
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0860)
